column4: guys , wget is not working ? is it called another thing in ubuntu or I need to install it ...
I hate to ask dump questions
-bash: wget: command not found
is there many of it ?
K
past the address you're trying to wgwet
look in synaptic to see if it is even there.
only one downloader open at a time as well.
they are on the pppa but if you run a update you will see the missing ones there is a command to load them.
this one ? add-apt-repository ppa:user/ppa-name
thanks
no if you run a update you will see a set of letter and numbers. this is the command sudo apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys
that command one space then the key from the update.
K,  will try that now
but ActionParsnip  is correct in that the first will load both.
yes , I ran it and got in the return msg : --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv D687A54E147F6B81BF3D2E914FEC4
ops , are these keys meant to be secret ?
there are the gpg signing key to secure your getting the right stuf basically.
like checksum md5 hash ?
in a sense yes but, this probably explains it better http://www.gnupg.org/gph/en/manual.html
thank you
no problem.
